channel.title: World News RSS Feed
channel.description: a RSS feed of articles for World News

item.title: Ukraine says it sank a $300 million Russian submarine in what would be yet another hammering for Putin's Black Sea Fleet
item.description: It is not the first time that the Rostov-on-Don sub, which Ukraine says cost Russia $300 million, has been targeted in the conflict.

item.title: Putin made a rare visit to a part of Russia that fought for independence. It's a chilling warning to Ukraine.
item.description: Vladimir Putin has tried to keep Chechnya, a predominantly Muslim region, under Russia's control ever since the collapse of the Soviet Union.

item.title: Here are the 5 longest-distance sniper kills in military history
item.description: In November 2023, a Ukrainian sniper broke the world record for the longest-distance sniper kill after he shot a Russian soldier from 2.36 miles away.

item.title: Ukraine appears to have just launched its largest attack on Russia's airbases as its invading forces push deeper into Kursk
item.description: Ukrainian long-range drones targeted multiple airfields overnight, according to local media reports citing security officials.

item.title: An elite Russian commander told Moscow's troops that they would 'go to heaven' if they died in Kursk
item.description: A Russian special forces unit commander told the parents of conscripts that their children would go to heaven if they died serving their country.

item.title: Russia is barely using one of its best weapons against Ukrainian forces in Kursk because it's scared to hit itself, war expert says
item.description: Russia has devastated Ukraine with glide bombs. But a war expert said it doesn't have good enough systems to avoid hitting its own assets in Kursk.

item.title: Russia says Ukrainian forces cross into border region, official says situation controllable
item.description: MOSCOW (Reuters) -Russia's defence ministry said on Tuesday that Ukraine had launched an attack into Russia's southern Kursk region, but Moscow's forces had ...

item.title: Trump splits with GOP lawmakers on national security, raising alarm
item.description: National security-minded Republican lawmakers are alarmed by what they see as a growing split between themselves and former President Trump on key issues...

item.title: Dad hacks database to fake death and avoid child support pay
item.description: The man, from Kentucky, has been jailed for what a judge in the US called his "cynical" actions.

item.title: Ukraine is taking out key bridges in Russia, isolating Russian soldiers on the wrong side of the river, analysts say
item.description: Ukraine is striking strategic bridges in Russia's Kursk region to create a 'buffer zone' and disrupt Russian logistics, according to military experts.

item.title: 'Russians are worried, but trust Putin to deliver peace'
item.description: The BBC's Steve Rosenberg in Aleksin finds out how Russians are reacting to Ukraine's incursion into the Kursk region.

item.title: Ukraine is striking targets hundreds of miles inside Russia for 3 key reasons, experts say
item.description: Ukraine has increasingly struck targets deep inside Russian territory in recent months, carrying out a number of hits on airbases and oil refineries.

item.title: Ukraine finally received F-16 fighter jets but might not be able to use them how it wants
item.description: The F-16s would likely stay away from the frontlines due to Russia's "superior aviation" and "very strong" defenses, Ukraine's top general said.

item.title: Ukrainian forces in Russia managed to fight through 2 defensive lines and a stronghold, analysts say
item.description: Ukrainian forces launched what appeared to be an unprecedented ground assault into Russia, attacking its Kursk region and drawing the ire of Putin.

item.title: Ukraine released its first official footage of its devastating Storm Shadow missiles in combat
item.description: Ukraine shared footage of a jet releasing Storm Shadow/SCALP missiles. One report said there's been no other official video of the missile in combat.

item.title: Ukraine said it shot down a $36 million Su-34 bomber jet inside Russia
item.description: Ukraine said it destroyed one of Russia's best and most expensive fighter jets over Kursk as its military pushes further into the region.

item.title: Russia has likely diverted thousands of soldiers to counter Ukraine offensive, US officials say
item.description: Ukraine likely hoped its Kursk incursion would force Russia to thin its frontlines, but they're just a small part of the forces being sent so far.

item.title: Now is the perfect time for Ukraine to be experimenting with ways to catch Russia by surprise, war analysts say
item.description: Ukraine's ongoing shock invasion of Russia adds to the list of unexpected ways its forces have been able to surprise Russia or retake the initiative.

item.title: Ukraine may have found new ships to target in its quest to hobble Russia's Black Sea Fleet
item.description: Ukrainian partisan group ATESH said it found two Russian Black Sea Fleet landing ships hidden amid cranes and infrastructure in Sevastopol, Crimea.

item.title: Ukraine says Russian cruise missile submarines are out in force as its Black Sea surface fleet falls back
item.description: Three submarines were deployed at once as Russia attempts to keep its surface ships out of harm's way.

item.title: [Removed]
item.description: [Removed]

item.title: Russia's largest attack on Ukraine just showed that its Black Sea Fleet is still dangerous despite its heavy losses
item.description: Ukraine said Russia fired 28 Kalibr cruise missiles from surface and underwater carriers in the eastern part of the Black Sea on Monday.

item.title: How Ukraine's three fronts on Russia are playing out
item.description: Ukraine is fighting Russia on three separate fronts: a recent incursion into Russia, an ongoing slugfest in eastern Ukraine and naval skirmishes in the Black Sea. We look at how all three are going.

item.title: Zelenskyy said Ukraine told no one about the Kursk invasion because its allies would have called it 'unrealistic'
item.description: "This is why nobody had been informed about our preparations. Now the real success speaks for itself," said the Ukrainian president.

item.title: How the Ukraine-Russia war is playing out differently on 3 separate fronts
item.description: Ukraine is holding ground it seized inside Russia. Yet Ukraine is losing villages inside its own territory. And in the Black Sea, the Russian Navy has been forced to retreat.

item.title: Mali cuts diplomatic ties with Ukraine over Wagner ambush claims
item.description: Kyiv has been accused of helping plan an ambush on Malian soldiers and the Russian mercenaries fighting alongside them.

item.title: Zelensky: North Korean missile likely killed father and son near Kiev
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky is calling for the lifting of restrictions on how Ukraine can use long-range weapons supplied by its Western allies...

item.title: Ukraine developed new shields for its US-made Bradleys, which are excelling against Russia
item.description: Ukraine has created new shields for its much admired US-supplied Bradley infantry fighting vehicles to help protect them from the threat of drones.

item.title: Thanks to the Pentagon, the Lords of Silicon Valley Are Having a Moment
item.description: Twin profiles of Thiel-backed, defense-minded, Silicon Valley moguls give us a glimpse of the future of war, and America.

item.title: The White House offered Putin a way to stop the Kursk invasion: 'Get the hell out of Ukraine'
item.description: The White House offered an "easy solution" to Russia after Putin complained of Ukraine's invasion of its Kursk region.

item.title: Ukrainian man plugged his whole house into a Tesla parked in his yard as locals find novel ways to battle rolling blackouts, report says
item.description: Russia has battered the Ukrainian energy grid in recent months as Vladimir Putin's forces have sought to break Ukraine's will to fight on.

item.title: 'They're tightening the screws': Kremlin ups attacks on critics abroad
item.description: With dissent snuffed out at home, Russia intensifies attacks on opponents seeking refuge in the West.

item.title: Fire at Nuclear Power Plant in Ukraine Puts Experts on Edge
item.description: Images of a cooling tower belching black are frightening, but Russia says its all under control now.

item.title: Ukraine says it hit Russian military airfield in Lipetsk region
Satellite images show long-range strikes destroyed a Russian aircraft that can drop glide bombs, Ukraine says
item.description: Ukraine's military intelligence agency said it destroyed one Su-34 fighter-bomber and likely damaged two more in the strike on Morozovsk airbase.

item.title: Report: Ukraine receives first batch of U.S.-made F-16 fighter jets
item.description: Ukraine has long sought the U.S.-made warplanes, saying they're needed to counter Russia's superior air power. Four NATO members have pledged F-16s, though it wasn't clear who sent them, or how many.

item.title: The Kremlin is trying to convince Russians to accept Ukraine's Kursk incursion as a 'new normal': report
item.description: The Kremlin is using propaganda to downplay Ukraine's Kursk incursion and instead emphasize Russian battlefield victories, sources told outlet Meduza.

item.title: Russian troops are gaining ground in eastern Ukraine
item.description: Russian forces are making small but steady gains in eastern Ukraine and seem to be targeting a key town. Ukraine is getting more Western weapons, but Russia still has more firepower and more troops.

item.title: Ukraine may have just scored its longest-range drone strike yet in Russian territory a Tu-22M3 supersonic bomber around 1,100 miles away
item.description: The Tu-22M3 is a long-range supersonic bomber designed to take out sea- and ground-based targets using guided missiles and aerial bombs.

item.title: Ukraine is making a point of treating Russian civilians very differently to how Russia treats Ukrainians in occupied territory
item.description: Ukrainian soldiers are providing food and aid to Russian civilians in Kursk, according to officials, in sharp contrast to Russian actions in Ukraine.

item.title: Here's what we know about Ukraine's military offensive in Russia
item.description: Ukraine is on day four of a surprise attack on Kursk, some 330 miles south of Moscow. Videos are emerging of burned out Russian vehicles, Russians surrendering and long lines of Russian cars fleeing.

item.title: A cheap Ukrainian drone managed to take out an $18 million Russian military helicopter: reports
item.description: Ukraine appears to be scoring successes by shooting down Russian helicopters using drones.

item.title: In a first since the war began, Ukraine launched an invasion into Russia
item.description: Ukraine invaded Russia this week - an attack that was shocking in scope and execution. Ukraines cross-border incursion into western Russia is now in its fifth day.

item.title: Traumatised Ukrainian lion moved to Kent sanctuary
item.description: Yuna is the first of five lions rescued from the warzone due to make a new home in Kent.

item.title: Ukrainian troops were seen pushing 6 miles into Russian territory, and the Kremlin can't decide if it's a 'large-scale provocation' or 'under control'
item.description: Ukraine has said little about its rare incursion into Russia. Its vehicles have been geolocated up to six miles past the border in Kursk.

item.title: It looks like Russia was massively unprepared for Ukraine's attack on its territory
item.description: While much is still unknown, Ukraine appears to have had the element of surprise in its recent incursion into Russia's Kursk region.

item.title: A fake political group that recruited a real candidate in Montana got banned on Facebook
item.description: Metas latest round of account takedowns includes a fake political group that ran dozens of dummy accounts in an attempt to recruit Americans to run for office. The social network detailed the scheme in its latest report on coordinated inauthentic behavior on

item.title: Ukraine's daring attack on Russia shows that surprise is not dead, even in a drone war, analysts say
item.description: Ukraine's attack on the Kursk region appeared to catch Russia by surprise, even as drones have made surprise moves very rare throughout this war.

item.title: The US is giving Ukraine a cache of advanced missiles and bombs to go with its F-16s: report
item.description: The US is giving Ukraine advanced missiles and bombs to pair with F-16s, boosting Kyiv's air capabilities, per The Wall Street Journal.

item.title: Ukraine's invasion of Russia is showing how good it is at hitting Putin's weak spots
item.description: Vladimir Putin's authority has long been founded on his image as an uncompromising defender of Russian security. Ukraine is changing that.

item.title: The battle of Kursk has unchained Ukraine from a failing war strategy
item.description: The battle of Kursk may not cripple Russia, but the invasion signals Ukraine's adoption of strategies that could unbalance the larger Russian forces.

item.title: Dramatic video shows Ukraine evacuating troops with a US-made Bradley fighting vehicle
item.description: The US-supplied Bradley vehicle has become among Ukraine's most important pieces of military equipment.

item.title: See inside the NYC-sized area of Russia that Ukraine seized in its lightning offensive
item.description: In its surprise Kursk offensive, Ukraine says it has seized about 488 square miles of Russian territory larger than the land area of New York City.

item.title: Russias Shahed-type drones are losing their bite in Ukraine
The US and Japan struck a deal to make more missiles for Patriots, which have proved crucial in Ukraine
item.description: Ukraine's success with US-made Patriot missile systems prompted US-Japan agreement in Tokyo to expand production.

item.title: Zaporizhzhia nuclear safety deteriorating, says UN
item.description: It follows a drone strike near the site's perimeter in Russian-occupied Ukraine.

item.title: She grew up in Ukraine, studied accounting, and joined the army. But since Russia invaded, she did a hard career pivot twice.
item.description: The war has created a big need for blue-collar workers in Ukraine. Women, like 32-year-old Yuliia Kuzmina, are stepping up.

item.title: Ukraine destroys 3rd key bridge, threatening to cut off Russian troops, amid incursion, Russian military bloggers say
item.description: Ukraine has reportedly destroyed a third and last key bridge in an area of Russia's Kursk region, according to Russian military bloggers, inflicting a...

item.title: Ukraine official says civilians have 'week or two' to evacuate key hub Pokrovsk
item.description: The Pokrovsk front remains the area with the most intense fighting in eastern Ukraine with a record number of clashes reported last week as the Ukrainian...

item.title: Zelenskyy says Ukraine tested a new weapon, its first ballistic missile
item.description: Zelenskyy said on Tuesday at the Ukraine 2024 Independence Forum in Kyiv that Ukraine tested its first homemade ballistic missile.

item.title: Ukraine attacks a second region in Western Russia, prompting a state of emergency
item.description: Ukrainian forces attack a second border region in western Russia, where the governor declares a state of emergency. Ukraine also targets air bases in at least a half-dozen regions.

item.title: Germany hopes interest from Russian assets will ease the strain of financing aid to Ukraine
item.description: German officials on Monday rejected suggestions that national budget constraints could hurt weapons deliveries to Ukraine. Berlin is its biggest supplier...

item.title: On a river between Ukraine and the EU, border guards search for draft evaders
item.description: Dozens have drowned trying to cross the river to EU-member Romania. Border guards are trying to stop them, as the Ukrainian military pushes mass conscription to address troop shortages.

item.title: Ukraine pushed Russia's Black Sea Fleet out of Crimea but retaking the peninsula will be incredibly hard
item.description: Ukraine has forced Russia's Black Sea Fleet out of Crimea, but it faces an uphill battle to retake the peninsula, experts said.

item.title: Ukraine is rationing shells on the front with ammo redirected for the assault on Kursk, commander says
item.description: Ukrainian soldiers are facing shell shortages in part due to Ukraine's assault on Russia's Kursk region, a commander told the Financial Times.

item.title: Video appears to show Ukrainian strike on key Russian bridge, which Moscow says was likely carried out using US-made HIMARS rockets
item.description: A spokesperson for the Russian foreign ministry said the strike was likely carried out using a HIMARS rocket system.

item.title: Ukraine says Russia targeted the enormous dam upstream of Kyiv as part of a massive bombardment
item.description: Officials have rushed to reassure Ukrainians after Kyiv's hydroelectric dam was targeted in a massive Russian drone and missile barrage on Monday.

item.title: Here is what Ukraine probably wants from its wild assault on Russian territory
item.description: Ukraine's surprise attack in Kursk could have multiple goals, including weakening the front lines, signaling strength to the West and angering Putin

item.title: The shock Ukrainian invasion of Kursk has the Kremlin pulling some troops out of Ukraine to defend Russia, per reports
item.description: After Ukraine launched a counter invasion of Russia, US officials told the Wall Street Journal Russia was pulling some troops back from Ukraine.

item.title: A new US Army unit is taking pointers from Ukraine on drones and electronic warfare
item.description: The Ukraine war has changed warfare, and the Pentagon is racing to incorporate the lessons.

item.title: JD Vance Reminds America to Turn on Disappearing Messages
item.description: If you dont want someone else to eventually read your disgusting secret group chat messages, youre going to have to delete them yourself.

item.title: A Russian general dismantled a border-protection group not long before Ukraine attacked, report says
item.description: A general's decision to disband a border defense group this year left Russia vulnerable to Ukraine's attack on Kursk, per The Wall Street Journal.

item.title: Ukraine's attack took perfect advantage of Russia's internal dysfunction, where nobody was in charge
item.description: Russia's convoluted and disorganized military structures likely hurt its abillity to defend against Ukraine's surprise attack on Kursk, experts say.

item.title: Ex-Google CEO Eric Schmidt says the Ukraine War turned him into an arms dealer
item.description: Eric Schmidt, the former Google CEO, called himself a 'licensed arms dealer' and said his new AI drone company will help Ukraine fight Russia.

item.title: JD Vance and the Republican vets who think American should do less, not more, abroad
item.description: JD Vance is the first veteran of Iraq or Afghanistan to appear on a presidential ballot. But he isnt a hawk; he leads a contingent of war veterans in the GOP who oppose U.S. military intervention overseas.

item.title: In a surprise attack, Ukraine sends a large force into western Russia
item.description: Ukrainian soldiers appear to be several miles inside Russias Kursk region, where they are in several villages. Russias top military official says some 1,000 Ukrainian troops are taking part.

item.title: Ukraine's shock invasion of Kursk takes away one of Russia's biggest advantages and may force it to rethink how this war is fought
item.description: Russia has been able to avoid committing too many troops to its border. But Ukraine's Kursk attack could take away that advantage, a war expert said.

item.title: The pixelated cyberpunk platformer Replaced has been pushed back to 2025
item.description: Sad Cat Studios announced on X that it is delaying its highly anticipated cyberpunk action game Replaced to next year. The studio says in its online statement that its expectations for the Xbox and PC exclusive are high since they first announced the game a

item.title: Videos of Russian soldiers appearing to surrender en masse suggest inexperience and desperation, experts say
item.description: Experts said the number of videos that show Russian soldiers surrendering to Ukraine in Kursk is exceptional.

item.title: Here's how Ukraine's audacious offensive in Kursk could backfire
item.description: Ukraine's Kursk offensive risks elite troops, key territory, and it getting pulled into an even bigger war of attrition, military experts told BI.

item.title: The US is sending less natural gas to Europe, complicating Europe's plans to cut off Russian gas
item.description: Last year, Europe still imported about 15% of its total gas supply from Russia, with about 9% coming from pipelines and 6% as liquid natural gas.

item.title: Russia makes breakthroughs in eastern Ukraine
item.description: Russian troops are pushing through weak spots to gain more ground on the front lines.

item.title: Lindsey Graham tried to stop Trump from choosing JD Vance as his VP pick, report says
item.description: The South Carolina senator reportedly preferred Sen. Marco Rubio. He's also strongly disagreed with Vance on Ukraine aid.

item.title: Ukraine just showed its low-cost, lightweight drones can destroy a Russian helicopter, Russian sources say
item.description: Russian military bloggers reported that an MI-8 helicopter was destroyed in Donetsk by Ukrainian first-person drones after months of close shaves.

item.title: Diplomatic tightrope for Modi as he visits Kyiv after Moscow
item.description: Modi is visiting Ukraine just weeks after his Russia trip. Is it a balancing act or is there something more?

item.title: Rosenberg: Ukraine's advance undermines Putin's image as 'Mr Security'
item.description: Ukraine's incursion into Kursk raises questions about Mr Putin's ability to keep Russia safe.

item.title: Ukraine keeps gaining ground in its push into Russia, with 74 settlements under its control, commander says
item.description: Ukraine's commander-in-chief said his forces were still advancing in Russia's Kursk region on Tuesday, capturing more territory.

item.title: Ukrainian forces now control more than 400 square miles of Russian territory
item.description: Ukraine says it has solidified its control over parts of Russia's Kursk region. NPR's Michel Martin talks to retired Lieutenant General Ben Hodges about Ukraine's strategic goals behind the operation.

item.title: Ukrainian paratroopers put out a new video they say shows the first hours of the invasion of Russia
item.description: Ukraine's incursion into Russia's Kursk region last week stunned Moscow, Kyiv's international partners, and conflict observers.

item.title: Russian dissident Kara-Murza tells BBC he thought he would die in prison
item.description: Vladimir Kara-Murza's joy at his release in the prisoner swap is marred by thoughts of Russian detainees who remain in jail.

item.title: Images of Ukraine's new F-16s and their weapons hint at what the US-made fighter jets may start off doing against the Russians
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy shared an official video of Kyiv's new F-16s armed with powerful air-to-air missiles.

item.title: Ukrainian releases video of Russian troops surrendering after a surprise attack
item.description: The Ukrainian military unexpectedly attacked on Russian soil. Ukraine released footage of Russian troops surrendering in the Kursk region.

item.title: Ukraine's shock invasion of Russia shows it can pull off complex, surprise attacks even on a modern battlefield where something's usually watching
item.description: Ukraine's offensive into Kursk shows that achieving surprise, even on a heavily surveilled modern battlefield, is still possible.

item.title: Russian allies in West Africa cut ties with Ukraine
item.description: Two West African countries have cut diplomatic ties with Ukraine. This follows claims that Ukraine helped anti-government rebels in Mali battle and possibly kill Malian soldiers and Russian forces.

item.title: Moscow says Ukraine struck a third bridge over Seym river in Russia's Kursk region
item.description: A Russian investigator said on Monday that Ukraine had struck and damaged a third bridge over the Seym river in Russia's Kursk region a day earlier, where...

item.title: Russia is putting up a stiffer fight in Kursk and is sending well-equipped soldiers, says Ukrainian commander
item.description: Ukraine is facing tougher resistance from redeployed Russian forces in Kursk, a Ukrainian commander said. "We're paying a price, too," he added.

item.title: Ukraine conducts drone attack on Russian airbase in Volgograd region, source says
item.description: Ukraine conducted a drone attack on Russia's Marinovka military airfield in the southern Russian region of Volgograd, striking a storage site for fuel and...

item.title: Russian troops likely facing water shortages in Ukraine, with some now drinking from 'stagnant puddles': UK intel
item.description: The shortages are likely the result of Russia's own strikes on utility infrastructure and have been made worse by high temperatures in Ukraine.

item.title: Ukraine says it used its new long-range 'Palianytsia' rocket drone for the first time as it targets air bases deep inside Russia
item.description: A video shared on X by Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy suggests the new rocket drone could hit targets about 400 miles inside Russia.

item.title: Ukraine is extending its record of flipping the script on Russia through innovation and audacity
item.description: Ukraine has long relied on the surprise element shown in its Kursk attack to offset Russia's advantages.
